channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping on ceres road, 4th November
item.description:
Yet more fly tipping on the corner of ceres road and kashgar road. Mattresses and belongings continue to be left here and I fell that cameras would be a very helpful addition to the road in order to deter this very common issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ceres Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken window, 4th November
item.description:
My flat has not been in use but on opening the property, I can see a broken window in the room upstairs. It could be the council when they were mowing the lawn A stone could’ve flicked up or somebody could’ve thrown a stone
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wick Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves, 4th November
item.description:
Leaves on pavement and road. Parish Lane outside 130, please clear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Lane, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish everywhere, 4th November
item.description:
Rubbish all over road and pavement on junction. Every day there is more. This problem needs to be resolved. It’s drawing in foxes, rats and encouraging more rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, St Saviour's Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped mattress as already reported still there but others have unwrapped it and moved it several times. It has ,as predicted, attracted further dumping as shown inc. Childs push chair and MDF material., 4th November
item.description:
As outlined above. Already reported a week ago. Adjacent to childs playroom and potential hindrance to access to retired peoples estate by ambulances and care vehicles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sycamore Close, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
There is a cardboard box full of magazines just laying under the bushes , been ghere for at least a month
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Common, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Fly tipping, 4th November
item.description:
There are now two lots of building waste on this beautiful green land. I hope the council will give it their priority. It deserves.

item.title: Urine in the street, 4th November
item.description:
There are always people urinating in the corner of the dental practice entrance. It stinks of urine constantly. It is always worse during the week after the weekends too. Please can it be sanitised and cleaned thoroughly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Street, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trampoline broken again, 4th November
item.description:
Same trampoline is broken again. With sharp wires now exposed, this needs to be fixed before a child gets hurt

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Caldecott Way, Hackney, London

item.title: Loose gravel on the road, lots., 4th November
item.description:
A lorry has shed a large amount of loose concrete gravel and cement powder, i was nearly hit by a large ''flying stone'' that came off a car tyre as it ran over the stones. Also the road is very steep there, with traffic lights and a pedestrian crossing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cricklewood Lane, London

item.title: Lighting in dark alleyway/footpath not working., 4th November
item.description:

item.title: Road not being swept or kept clean, 4th November
item.description:
Tottenham road continues to be unswept with rubbish and leaves everywhere. Haven't seen the usual roadsweeper for weeks and it seems like no-one else is doing his job.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tottenham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, William Booth Road, Crystal Palace, London

item.title: One Light in Reeves Mews street and two lights in Park Street, 4th November
item.description:
Please arrange for the repair of one street light on Reeves Mews and two street lights on Park Street, as the area is currently very dim at night and poses a safety concern for pedestrians and vehicles. I had previously reported the issue on Park Street on 8 October 2025, but unfortunately, the lights are still not functioning. Kindly inspect and repair the faulty lights at the earliest possible opportunity to help prevent any potential incidents. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Reeves Mews, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish and used nappies in trees/bushes running along path Littlestone Close, 4th November
item.description:
Lots of rubbish through the bushes that run across the front of 36-29 Littlestone Close, including used nappies which will attract rats. You will need to step behind the low wooden fence to walk through the trees/bushes. I had previously raised this request to street cleansing but they rejected it and told me to raise it for parks / green spaces. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Littlestone Close, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
